longer than 41 weeks. Your midwife or doctor should:
• use a tape or undertake an ultrasound scan  to 
measure the size of your uterus and plot on your 
individual growth chart;
• measure your blood pressure and test your urine 
for protein;
• discuss	flu,	whooping	cough	and	COVID-19;
• discuss your baby’s movements.

Your midwife or doctor should give you more 
information about what happens if your 
pregnancy lasts longer than 41 weeks
